trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon XML.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> class when you receive a token over the wire that is not defined in a specification or there is no way for you to determine the type of the security token.
For example, in a federation scenario when you send a Request Security Token (RST) to a Security Token Service (STS) you do not always know the type of the security token returned by the STS.
In such cases, you can use a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> to store the security token as XML along with its internal and external references.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> class to define claims using XML when one of the built-in security tokens does not suffice.

Other security tokens can define their claims using XML, however the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token generically allows a security token to have an application-defined set of XML.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken"></xref> class.

When the `internalTokenReference` parameter is `null`, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.LocalIdKeyIdentifierClause> key identifier clause is created for this security token and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> property.
When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> is obtained in a federation scenario, the proof token contains the key that is encrypted for the client.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> that represents the XML that is associated with the security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.TokenXml"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the proof token for the security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ProofToken"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom"></xref> property.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy"></xref> that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.
tokenXml is `null`.
-or-
proofToken is `null`.
Gets the collection of authorization policies for this security token.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy"></xref> that contains the set authorization policies for this security token.
Gets a value that indicates whether this security token is capable of creating the specified key identifier clause.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method to determine if a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token can create a specific key identifier.
To create the key identifier call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.
`true` when T is not `null` and the same type as either the or property values; otherwise, `false`.
Creates the specified key identifier clause.

The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> property is returned by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%2A> method depending on the type that is passed into the `T` parameter.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CanCreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method to determine if a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token can create a specific key identifier.
To create the key identifier call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.CreateKeyIdentifierClause%60%601> method.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that specifies the key identifier to create.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertionKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that is a key identifier clause for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
T is not `null` and not the same type as one of the or property values.
Gets a security key identifier clause that references this security token when this security token is not included in the SOAP message in which it is referenced.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents a reference to this security token when it is not included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token is serialized into XML, the value of the `Id` attribute is set to the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
The unique identifier of the security token.
Gets a security key identifier clause that references this security token when this security token is included in the SOAP message in which it is referenced.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents a reference to this security token when it is included in a SOAP message in which it is referenced.
Returns a value that indicates whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.

The `keyIdentifierClause` parameter is matched against the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> property values using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.Matches%2A> method on the key identifier clause that is returned by the property values.
`true` when skiClause is not `null` and matches either the or property values; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the proof token for the security token.

The proof token is the security token that the requester of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token used for authentication in obtaining the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the proof token for the security token.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the proof token.
The proof token can be obtained by getting the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ProofToken%2A> property.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the proof token.
Gets the XML that is associated with the security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> security token is extensible, so exactly what is contained within the XML is application-dependent.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> that represents the XML that is associated with the security token.
Returns the current object.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ToString%2A> method returns the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.InternalTokenReference%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ExternalTokenReference%2A> properties.
The current object.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified using the `effectiveTime` parameter of the constructor.
The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties to determine the time period in which a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken> token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> properties represent the first and last instants in time in which the security token is valid, respectively.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> property is specified using the `expirationTime` parameter of the constructor.
The value returned from this property is always in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
